title: Share of economic sectors in the GDP in Ghana 2018
summary: This is a multi-line chart with 3 lines representing Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis denotes Share in GDP and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Industry is gradually increasing, Agriculture, and Services are gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Overall across the Year, Services mostly maintained the highest Share in GDP when compared to others with a mean value of 43.54, and it peaked at 2010.
Followed by Industry which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 27.1 Share in GDP,reaching its highest point  at 2013 with a value of 34.8.
The botommost line, Agriculture,  has a mean of 23.08, and peaked at 2009.
min_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis indicates the Share in GDP and the x axis indicates Year.

Agriculture mostly had the least Share in GDP with a mean value of 23.08, which peaked at 2009 with a value of 30.99.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 3 lines denoting Agriculture, Industry, and Services. The y axis indicates the Share in GDP and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Industry is gradually increasing, Agriculture, and Services are gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Services, 2. Industry, and lastly, 3. Agriculture.
Throughout the period, Services generally had the highest Share in GDP relative to others with an average of 43.54, and it reached its maximum at 2010 with a value of 48.18.
Followed by Industry which ranks as the second topmpost line , with an average of 27.1 Share in GDP,reaching its highest point  at 2013 with a value of 34.8.
